Mexican.title: Authentic Tacos al Pastor
Mexican.instructions: Mix achiote paste, white vinegar, orange juice, pineapple juice, minced garlic, oregano, cumin, black pepper, and salt to make marinade. Coat thinly sliced pork shoulder with marinade and refrigerate for 4 hours. Thread marinated pork onto skewers with pineapple slices. Grill over medium-high heat for 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until pork is cooked through and slightly charred. Warm corn tortillas on the grill. Remove pork and pineapple from skewers and chop finely. Serve pork and pineapple on warm tortillas with diced onion, cilantro, lime wedges, and salsa verde.

Mexican.title: Mole Poblano
ingredients: 6 dried ancho chiles, stemmed and seeded
4 dried pasilla chiles, stemmed and seeded
1/2 large white onion, quartered and roasted
Mexican.instructions: Toast sesame seeds, almonds, peanuts, and pumpkin seeds in a dry pan until golden. Remove and set aside. Stem and seed the dried chiles, then toast them briefly. Soak chiles in hot water for 20 minutes. In a blender, combine soaked chiles, toasted nuts and seeds, raisins, Mexican chocolate, roasted onion, garlic, cinnamon, cumin, and cloves. Blend until smooth, adding chicken broth as needed. Heat oil in a large pot and fry the mole paste for 5 minutes. Add remaining broth and simmer for 30 minutes until thickened. Add chicken pieces and simmer for 20 minutes until chicken is cooked through. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice and warm tortillas.

Mexican.title: Enchiladas Verdes
ingredients: 2 lbs boneless skinless chicken breast, poached and shredded
1.5 lbs fresh tomatillos, husked and rinsed
1/2 cup fresh cilantro leaves and stems
1 cup Mexican crema or sour cream
1.5 cups Monterey Jack cheese, freshly grated
Mexican.instructions: Boil tomatillos and jalapeños in water for 10 minutes until soft. Drain and blend with diced onion, garlic, cilantro, lime juice, and salt to make salsa verde. Heat vegetable oil in a pan and lightly fry corn tortillas for 30 seconds each. Dip each tortilla in salsa verde and fill with shredded chicken breast. Roll up and place seam-side down in a baking dish. Pour remaining salsa verde over enchiladas. Top with sour cream and shredded Monterey Jack cheese. Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve hot with rice and beans.

Mexican.title: Pozole
ingredients: 2 lbs pork shoulder, cut into 2-inch cubes
6 dried guajillo chiles, stemmed and seeded
4 dried ancho chiles, stemmed and seeded
Mexican.instructions: Soak hominy overnight. Cook pork shoulder cubes in a large pot with chicken stock, diced onion, minced garlic, oregano, cumin, and bay leaf for 1.5 hours until tender. Add soaked hominy and cook for an additional 30 minutes. Stem and seed dried chiles, then toast briefly. Soak chiles in hot water for 20 minutes. Blend chiles with some cooking liquid until smooth. Add chile puree to pozole and simmer for 15 minutes. Season with salt. Serve hot with radishes, shredded cabbage, cilantro, lime wedges, and avocado slices.

Mexican.title: Chiles Rellenos
ingredients: 1 lb Monterey Jack cheese, cut into thick strips
Mexican.instructions: Roast poblano peppers over an open flame until charred. Place in a paper bag to steam for 10 minutes. Peel off charred skin and make a small slit to remove seeds. Stuff peppers with Monterey Jack cheese strips. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Beat egg yolks and fold into whites. Coat stuffed peppers with flour, then dip in egg mixture. Heat vegetable oil and fry peppers until golden brown. For sauce, sauté diced onion and minced garlic. Add diced tomatoes, oregano, and chicken stock. Simmer for 10 minutes. Pour sauce over fried peppers and garnish with fresh cilantro.

Mexican.title: Tamales
ingredients: 1 lb pork shoulder, slow-cooked and shredded
Mexican.instructions: Soak corn husks in warm water for 30 minutes. Mix masa harina with lard, chicken stock, baking powder, and salt to form a smooth dough. Spread masa dough on corn husks. Fill with shredded pork shoulder, red chile sauce, and Monterey Jack cheese. Fold husks to enclose filling and tie with strips of husk. Steam tamales for 1 hour until masa is firm. Serve hot with salsa and fresh cilantro.

Mexican.title: Guacamole
ingredients: 2 medium Roma tomatoes, seeded and diced
Mexican.instructions: Cut avocados in half and remove pits. Scoop out flesh into a bowl. Mash avocados with a fork until smooth but still chunky. Add lime juice, diced onion, diced tomatoes, minced jalapeño, fresh cilantro, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper. Mix gently to combine. Taste and adjust seasoning. Serve immediately with tortilla chips to prevent browning.

Mexican.title: Churros
ingredients: 4 cups vegetable oil for deep frying
Mexican.instructions: Bring water, butter, and salt to a boil in a saucepan. Remove from heat and stir in all-purpose flour until mixture forms a ball. Beat in eggs one at a time until smooth. Transfer dough to a piping bag fitted with a star tip. Heat vegetable oil to 375°F. Pipe 4-inch strips of dough into hot oil. Fry for 2-3 minutes until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Mix sugar and cinnamon. Roll hot churros in cinnamon sugar. Serve warm with chocolate sauce for dipping.

Mexican.title: Mexican Ceviche
ingredients: 1 lb fresh white fish fillets (mahi-mahi, halibut, or sea bass), cubed
2 large Roma tomatoes, seeded and diced
Mexican.instructions: Cut fresh white fish into small cubes. Combine lime juice and lemon juice in a bowl. Add fish cubes and marinate in citrus juices for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. The acid will 'cook' the fish. Drain excess juice and add diced red onion, diced tomatoes, minced jalapeño, fresh cilantro, diced avocado, and diced cucumber. Add orange juice, salt, and black pepper. Mix gently to combine. Refrigerate for 15 minutes to allow flavors to meld. Serve cold with tortilla chips.

Mexican.title: Flan
Mexican.instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Heat sugar and water in a saucepan over medium heat until sugar dissolves and turns amber. Pour caramel into 6 ramekins, swirling to coat bottoms. Beat eggs in a bowl. Add sweetened condensed milk, evaporated milk, vanilla extract, and salt. Mix until smooth. Pour custard mixture over caramel in ramekins. Place ramekins in a baking dish and add hot water to come halfway up sides. Bake for 45 minutes until set. Let cool completely. Run a knife around edges and invert onto plates. Drizzle with caramel sauce and serve chilled.
